bibl.title: The Surge in Prices under Ptolemies IV and V.
bibl.note: The artifact. Bronze weight, 80.14 gm, late third century BC (private collection, S.M. Huston, San Francisco). Bears on one side a raised = for the sum δυόβολοι (on the silver standard), on the other side a raised Μ for the comparable sum (i.e. 40 <χαλκοῦ δραχμαί>). - Prices expressed in bronze currency. - The level of production. - The velocity of the bronze coinage. - Conclusions.
bibl.seg: R.A. Hazzard & S.M. Huston, The Surge in Prices under Ptolemies IV and V.

The artifact. Bronze weight, 80.14 gm, late third century BC (private collection, S.M. Huston, San Francisco). Bears on one side a raised = for the sum δυόβολοι (on the silver standard), on the other side a raised Μ for the comparable sum (i.e. 40 <χαλκοῦ δραχμαί>). - Prices expressed in bronze currency. - The level of production. - The velocity of the bronze coinage. - Conclusions.
